snippet: Though awareness of the nation’s transgender population has grown, medical networks are still scrambling to catch up with that group’s highly specialized needs....
abstract: American health care system is scrambling to accommodate needs of nation's 1.4 million transgender people, many of whom avoid tests and medical care involving parts of their anatomy associated with their original gender; many hospitals and professional schools have initiated training for employees and students on handling medical and personal needs of transgender patients.
lead_paragraph: Though awareness of the nation’s transgender population has grown, medical networks are still scrambling to catch up with that group’s highly specialized needs.

headline.main: Living as a Man, Fighting Breast Cancer: How Trans People Face Care Gaps
headline.print_headline: First, Fighting Cancer. Next, Tackling Issues in Transgender Care.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
